publicationStmt.p: This is an XML-TEI markup of the original publications by SIL Mexico for the purposes of: archival and for the creation of a body of Mixtepec-Mixtec language resources (LR) (ISO: mix). Encoded documents used with the permission of original authors.

notesStmt.note: Una señora lechera soñaba en cómo ganar dinero, pero por su propia culpa, no logró su sueño

sourceDesc.bibl: Ña xico xikui Beckmann, Gisela; Nieves, María M.. 2007. (2nd ed.). Instituto Lingüístico de Verano, A.C. Tlalpan, D.F., México Obtained from:

textDesc.channel: @mode:'w' means that the primary means of utilising this document is by reading it's written form;
textDesc.derivation: this document is labeled "original" because the XML-TEI markup of it's contents have not made any alterations to the original content;

normalization.ab: 2018-02-05Spelling of lexical items which in the old orthography were homographs and which have been changed according to updated orthographic principles as per ../Mille/GUIA_ORTOGRAFICA_PRELIMINAR_Short_version.xml

list.item: Mixtec content found at following locations: //text[@xml:lang='mix']/body/div/p/seg/w

English translations are defined in relation to their Mixtec equivalents in the following location: //text[@xml:lang='mix']/body/div/p/spanGrp[@type='translation']/span the value of //span[@target] is the pointer to the Mixtec translation equivalentwhere preceding sibling is: //text[@xml:lang='mix']/body/div/p/seg

Spanish translations are defined in relation to their Mixtec equivalents in the following location: //text[@xml:lang='mix']/body/div/p/spanGrp[@type='translation']/span the value of //span[@target] is the pointer to the Mixtec translation equivalentwhere preceding sibling is: //text[@xml:lang='mix']/body/div/p/seg

spanGrp.span: There lived a woman who was a milk vendor.
Había una mujer que vendía leche.
One day she went to the market to sell milk and then she said:
Un día fue al mercado para vender leche, y dijó:
When I get money, I will buy eggs.
Cuando yo consiga dinero, compraré huevos.
I will put the eggs under the chicken.
Pondría los huevo abajo del pollo.
Then the little baby chickens hatch again.
Y los pollitos nazcan de nuevo.
When the baby chickens hatch, I will feed them when they grow they'll become big chickens.
Cuando los pollitos nazcan, le daría a comer, cuando el crezca, se volverá pollos viejos.
Then when it becomes old, I will sell it, I'll buy a pig.
Y cuando se vuelva viejo, yo lo venderé y yo compraría un cierdo.
Voy a dar comer el puerco.
When it's old, I'll buy a small bull.
Quando está viejo, voy a comprar un pequeño toro.
The woman was thinking and worrying while walking on the road.
La mujer estababa pensando y se preocupava mientre caminaba por el camino.
That woman was thinking and worrying and then she was happy.
Aquella mujer pensaba, y se preocupaba y entonces estaba feliz.
Then she jumped and all of a sudden she fell down and the pot spilled out all its milk.
Y ella saltó y de repente, se cayó y toda la leche derramó de la olla.
Then she began to tear up, she then said:
Forget the milk, forget the money, forget the eggs, forget the chicken, forget the pig, forget the baby bull.
Olivide la leche, olivide el denaro, olivide los huevos, olivide el pollo, olivide el cierdo, olivide el torocito.
She said, because all my milk spilled, I will never get money.
Dijó, por causa de que mi leche se derramó yo nunca consigeré dinero.
